snippet: Revelations that Islamist supporters of Mohamed Morsi detained dozens of his political opponents last week threaten to undermine the Egyptian president’s credibility.
abstract: Islamist supporters of Egyptian Pres Mohamed Morsi capture and detain dozens of his political opponents, beating and pressuring them to confess that they had accepted money to use violence in protests against him; revelations of abuses, which have been documented through videos and victim testimonies, are threatening to undermine Morsi's credibility.
lead_paragraph: Revelations that Islamist supporters of Mohamed Morsi detained dozens of his political opponents last week threaten to undermine the Egyptian president’s credibility.

headline.seo: Allies of Egypt’s Morsi Beat Protesters Outside Palace
headline.main: Morsi’s Opponents Describe Abuse by President’s Allies
headline.print_headline: Morsi’s Allies Beat Protesters Outside Palace
